intro: Cestichis orbiculata, commonly known as the orbiculate cestichis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are usually clustered in whorls and display a range of colors, including shades of pink and purple, making it an attractive ornamental plant. Cestichis orbiculata thrives in well-drained soils and requires moderate to high light exposure for optimal growth.
